title: MySQLCURRENT_DATE()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLCURRENT_DATE()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the current date:
SELECT CURRENT_DATE();

Definition and Usage
The CURRENT_DATE() function returns the current date.
Note:
The date is returned as 
"YYYY-MM-DD" (string) or as YYYYMMDD (numeric).
Note:
This function equals the
CURDATE()
function.
Syntax
CURRENT_DATE()
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the current date + 1:
SELECT CURRENT_DATE() + 1;

❯
★
+1
